channel.title: small group on courtside nyc
channel.description: Recent content in small group on courtside nyc

item.title: eavesdrop
item.description: thoughts def need a res food surprisingly good menu highlights cold sesame noodles

item.title: chez ma tante
item.description: menu highlights bloody mary pancakes

item.title: la dong
item.description: thoughts space is beautiful menu highlights crab fried rice draft lager

item.title: ivan ramen
item.description: thoughts spicy ramen is actually spicy, you’ve been warned menu highlights karaage chicken spicy cucumber

item.title: rana fifteen
item.description: menu highlights want to try chef’s tasting menu next time $45 per person for 8 apps + 4 mezes + 1 side + 1 entree + dessert

item.title: cecelia
item.description: thoughts could easily stay and yap for hours

item.title: miss ada
item.description: thoughts flavors go crazy homey, warms the heart menu highlights chicken shawarma cauliflower

item.title: atla
item.description: thoughts amazing brunch, but also think it would be good for date night menu highlights al pastor

item.title: pies n thighs
item.description: thoughts want to try to everything on the menu menu highlights chicken biscuit pie obviously

item.title: theodora
item.description: thoughts excellent, but prefer sister restaurant miss ada menu highlights za’atar kubaneh cauliflower swordfish skewer

item.title: bungalow
item.description: thoughts 10/10 no notes menu highlights daal bungalow anarkali chicken spice roasted pineapple post dinner chai also delicious

item.title: coqodaq
item.description: thoughts the big sink with like 15 soaps to wash your hands right at the entrance was simply delightful service 10/10 no notes coat check menu highlights chicken bucket duh caviar not necessary imo

item.title: nan xiang xiao long bao
item.description: locations east village midtown williamsburg flushing - the og thoughts easy, delicious menu highlights soup dumplings

item.title: little ruby's
item.description: thoughts giving just moved to the west village menu highlights spicy vodka pasta hits

item.title: salma
item.description: thoughts byob menu highlights v good hummus

item.title: ma • dé
item.description: thoughts seasonal veggies & fish

item.title: cozy royale
item.description: thoughts if i was a local i’d come here a lot menu highlights burger

item.title: llama inn
item.description: thoughts easy to get a res menu highlights snow peas lamb sausage

item.title: lucia alimentari
item.description: thoughts bop easy repeat menu highlights little gem caesar vodka pizza

item.title: kanyakumari
item.description: thoughts fantastic menu highlights from mumbai - samrat vada pav

item.title: bangkok supper club
item.description: thoughts open kitchen unique cocktails menu highlights hokkaido scallop ceviche pork jowl bangkok gai yang

item.title: cafe camellia
item.description: thoughts heavy on the fried food, but no regrets menu highlights fried green tomatoes crab claws red beans & rice

item.title: altro paradiso
item.description: thoughts underrated, top 5 outdoor seating on a nice day, woww menu highlights chicken milanese pesto & ramp pasta (likely seasonal) fennel & arancini were also bops

item.title: ayat
item.description: new york locations east village bayridge industry city staten island thoughts underrated menu highlights maklouba mansaf

item.title: bad hombre
item.description: thoughts took a long time to make our drinks, but brought us a free dessert menu highlights aguachille skirt steak

item.title: sappe
item.description: thoughts they have semi private room for party of 8, super cozy staff were so kind and patient with my large group pre-fixe $80 for more than 8 people menu highlights online cocktail menu krapow moo grob ribs (rack)

item.title: málà project
item.description: 4 locations thoughts yummy menu highlights dry pot (spicy) eggplant app is fire

item.title: the nines
item.description: thoughts acme downstairs, opens 10:30 max table holds 6 people

item.title: veeray da dhaba
item.description: menu highlights veeray di gobhi

item.title: golden diner
item.description: thoughts walk-in only on weekends (waits can range anywhere from 1-4 hours lol) go during week when they accept resys menu highlights pancake tuna melt

item.title: revelie luncheonette
item.description: thoughts would go just to hang with eric again walk-in only menu highlights green chile cheeseburger chopped cheese egg sandwich

item.title: konbon
item.description: thoughts fantastic menu highlights scallop carpaccio mazemen (not spicy) corn dessert is so realistic i looked at the table next to us trying to cut theirs in half and thought to myself “who the fuck cuts corn like that”

item.title: raoul's
item.description: thoughts immaculate vibes fortune teller upstairs ($50 cash only) they hold 8 bar seats for walk-ins menu highlights steak frites - loaded with peppercorns, fantastic brussel sprouts

item.title: figure eight
item.description: menu highlights long beans sun chokes corn jalepeño bolobao

item.title: tonchin
item.description: menu highlights known for their “pizza” ramen, i had to try it. it did taste like a pizza, but next time im just going to get the classic spicy tonkotsu

item.title: c as in charlie
item.description: menu highlights popcorn chicken doodle dessert so fun

item.title: rynn
item.description: thoughts wonderful new neighborhood spot in the east village menu highlights mango lemonade is an absolute slay. pairs perfectly with the spicy items on the menu tum strawberry

item.title: ensenada
item.description: thoughts closest any place has come to rival contramar. turns into a bar - black flamingo is inside in the basement menu highlights tostada de atun - classic. can’t miss. aguachile negro - seriously spicy, but my favorite dish of whole meal. pescado del dia “al pastor” - riff on contramar’s two-color butterfly fish. al pastor is my favorite, so i loved this. jaiba suave - soft shell crab, sits on top a green chorizo & beans. one of the best flavor combinations i’ve ever had.

item.title: ella funt
item.description: thoughts also cool bar scene menu highlights chicken

item.title: dhamaka
item.description: thoughts to answer your question - “is it worth the hype?” - yes. be prepared for amazing smells to hit you like a truck every time you walk into essex market menu highlights ragda pattice - this was my favorite dish
menu highlights popcorn chicken black pepper beef

item.title: cafe mogador
item.description: east village williamsburg thoughts east village classic menu highlights amba (side sauce)

item.title: dame
item.description: thoughts top contender for best meal of 2023 menu highlights everything is good, can’t miss the fish n chips though such a good wine list

item.title: traif
item.description: thoughts hidden gem menu highlights chef’s selection tasting menu is gas

item.title: superiority burger
item.description: thoughts walk-in only. get here just before it opens for an early dinner. bar in the back - serves pints of ice cream and burgers late nite do not skip dessert menu highlights can’t go wrong

item.title: seoul salon
item.description: thoughts walk-in bar seating menu highlights pancake fried chicken

item.title: foxface
item.description: thoughts been going to foxface since their sandwich shop window days - always got to try something fun and interesting first time i ever had rabbit was on a sandwich from here. their restaurant is no different, delicious & unique menu highlights try something you’ve never heard of before, you’ll probably love it

item.title: silver apricot
item.description: menu highlights scallion puffs

item.title: jiang's kitchen
item.description: thoughts halal - uyghur chinese restaurant northwestern chinese food (xinjiang region) menu highlights fried noodle w/ spicy minced beef hot and sour cucumber

item.title: gazab
item.description: thoughts criminally underrated usually have resys available at the last minute menu highlights tandoori pineapple bokchoy chaat

item.title: ariari
item.description: thoughts inspired by the port city of busan korean comfort food that’s seafood heavy menu highlights yook-hoe - beef tartare fried softshell crab

item.title: emmett's on grove
item.description: thoughts super thin crust pizza is delicious and 6 “slices” feels like 1 normal slice of pizza, so your group can order multiple pizzas and not live in fear of leftovers or over-ordering i saw two birthday dinners during my 2 hour dining experience and they bring out sparklers! they have a couple big tables, but the best is the giant circular booth in the back left corner. you can fit 10 friends and get to talk to everyone! menu highlights key lime pie was so good it brought tears to my eyes.

item.title: yellow rose
item.description: thoughts the tacos are delicious, but the apps are the real star of the show menu highlights lonestar beer queso is a must sheet cake

item.title: foul witch
item.description: thoughts rip to the fire and ice. you will be missed. menu highlights veal tortellini sorana beans

item.title: sonnyboy
item.description: menu highlights table pancakes

item.title: omar's kitchen & rum bar
item.description: thoughts literally everything is good

item.title: nonna dora's
item.description: thoughts in a city with an italian restaurant on every block, this place soars above the average food was amazing and the staff were so so kind! menu highlights meatballs they have a negroni menu

item.title: holiday bar
item.description: thoughts interesting concept, menu pulls all the best dishes the owners have had while on “holiday” - i.e. tuna tostada is clearly from contramar, cdmx (but not as good, duh)

item.title: cheli
item.description: menu highlights smoked fish

item.title: noreetuh
item.description: thoughts underrated menu highlights musubi

item.title: malaparte
item.description: menu highlights tiramisu excellent

item.title: kiki's
item.description: thoughts walk-in only. the restaurant is low-key huge so i’ve never had to wait a long time. also there’s so many cool bars close by for you to go grab a drink while you wait. menu highlights maroulosalata salad zucchini chips grilled octopus mixed grill

item.title: 11 tigers
item.description: thoughts chaotic but wasn’t mad about it, fit the vibe

item.title: szechuan mountain house
item.description: thoughts this was the first time i has proper szechuan food. i thought i was having an allergic reaction because of the sensations the peppercorns created in my mouth. so don’t fret! it’s just that good. menu highlights swing pork belly la-zi chicken sauteed chinese long beans w. eggplant

item.title: shukette
item.description: thoughts one of my all time favorite restaurants in new york. menu highlights get all the breads and dips

item.title: miss lily's
item.description: thoughts dinner is underrated

item.title: mono + mono
item.description: thoughts also a going out spot - come for a late dinner and stay! dj spins late night. beautiful on the inside. plants everywhere, behing the bar is filled with fermenting jars of soju, walls are covered in records. menu highlights fried chicken is gas

item.title: sidney's five
item.description: thoughts just good vibes all around. menu highlights corn dogs lol

item.title: lhasa
item.description: thoughts underrated. gem of the east village. menu highlights momo (tibetan dumplings)

item.title: frenchette
item.description: thoughts they have cozy booths that are great for a party of 4-6 menu highlights sourghdough pancake (only served for brunch on saturdays & sundays)

item.title: hanoi house
item.description: menu highlights braised beef bahn mi - reminded me of a french dip sandwich (but better) because you get a side of pho broth for dipping.

item.title: thai diner
item.description: thoughts i have waited anywhere from 20 mins to 1.5 hours for a table here, but it’s deinitely worth it. better to get there early, put your name in, and grab a drink at one of the million bars in the area. i recommend mother’s ruin they have limited resys, but i think they’re more flexible for a large party of more than 7. menu highlights disco fries pea shoots mango sticky rice

item.title: haile
item.description: thoughts bomb ethiopian run by two sisters

item.title: semma
item.description: thoughts the best restaurant in new york. such a tough res, but i think bar seating might be first come first serve. they only book through resy and allow max number of 6 people per table. menu highlights can’t go wrong. you could blindly point at the menu and end up with the best meal of your life. pre-ordering the dungeness crab is so worth it.

item.title: nat's on bank
item.description: thoughts rip nat’s on bleecker

item.title: veselka
item.description: menu highlights if you’re debating between boiled or fried perogis, go with boiled.

item.title: spicy moon
item.description: thoughts so good you won’t even know it’s vegan. there’s two locations. one in the east village and one in the west village, but the ev location is my favorite. menu highlights bathe me in the spicy wontons in chili oil.

item.title: the izakaya
item.description: thoughts two locations. original is on 6th and newer is on 4th menu highlights kastu sandwich usually sells out, people line up for it

item.title: the tyger
item.description: menu highlights osyters are unreal. served with crispy shallots. miso butter escargot (if you’re feeling adventurous) some of the most fun cocktails i’ve ever had

item.title: thursday kitchen
item.description: thoughts glowing capri sun cocktails are a little corny, but still kinda fun.

item.title: queen of sheba
item.description: thoughts my go to spot when i lived in hell’s kitchen.

item.title: ippudo
item.description: thoughts two locations one in the east village and another in hell’s kitchen save some tables for walk-ins menu highlights karaka spicy bao buns & shisitos

item.title: ladybird
item.description: thoughts vegan

item.title: flex mussels
item.description: menu highlights classic white wine thai

item.title: empellon al pastor
item.description: thoughts perfect for crushing margs and inhaling tacos day or nite

item.title: somtum der
item.description: thoughts this is my favorite restaurant in nyc. it’s simple comfort food that makes my heart happy. i always take visitors here and it’s my go to place for a last minute celebration meal with the roomies - so many good memories here. menu highlights larb moo por pia larb moo - not sure what they put in the dipping sauce buts it’s as addictive as ranch.

item.title: aria
item.description: thoughts sit at the bar

item.title: wondee siam
item.description: thoughts go-to spot when i lived in hell’s kitchen menu highlights crispy pork
